text: Good morning all you ember slackers out there.  I had to put this off for awhile but I’m back to figuring out this hashbang issue.  I have to use it because I have a sub-domain and the back button and refresh won’t work without the hash (and hopefully will work with hashbang also.)  I found this article but I keep getting errors when I try to implement it.  It might just be a simple thing I am overlooking  Any thoughts?  <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22769586/ember-js-deprecation-of-registerimplementation-in-favour-of-app-initializer>

attachments.title: Ember.js deprecation of registerImplementation in favour of App.initializer
attachments.text: I am using an extension of HashLocation to implement a hashbang url type for Ember.js.Here is the code snippet:(function() {var get = Ember.get, set = Ember.set;
attachments.fallback: Ember.js deprecation of registerImplementation in favour of App.initializer

text: <@U0LVBSC67>: morning, did you you figure this one out?
Hi Jamie.  No, not yet.
I think it has to do with calling app.  It says app is not defined
yeah, that answer’s out of date unfortunately
this may be useful: <http://emberjs.com/api/classes/Ember.Location.html#toc_custom-implementation>

attachments.title: Ember.js: Ember.Location
attachments.text: Ember.js helps developers be more productive out of the box. Designed with developer ergonomics in mind, its friendly APIs help you get your job done—fast.

text: so these days you don’t have to actively register the implementation
> Ember scans app/locations/* for extending the Location API.
just having a think about how exactly you’d write HashBangLocation these days
Yeah I was wondering
was going to ask
would I just replace history-url-logging with hashbang?
no, it’d be a little different
just a sec, running a quick experiment
<@U0LVBSC67>: here’s my attempt: <https://github.com/jgwhite/hash-bang-example/commit/41c916a715de8b4d541a30289cc0585e04d6abcd>
not quite working yet though!
That totally makes sense.  I tried something similar but was off a little.  I will try yours now
oh
it sets the URL correctly, but isn’t reading from it
okay, got it I think
I’ve just set up a new app to try it again now
okay, this is more robust: <https://github.com/jgwhite/hash-bang-example/commit/9a2b797dc1ccd3c302404a50081d3f7ada52feaf>
unfortunately simply calling through to `_super` in `setURL` and `replaceURL` is tricky because it stores off the path
but let me know how you get on with that code
and note this line: <https://github.com/jgwhite/hash-bang-example/commit/9a2b797dc1ccd3c302404a50081d3f7ada52feaf#diff-695693c5dabaffb064bde5b060195ff7R8>
ok trying now
thanks for the help by the way
np
Looks like it is working in the demo.  Now I am going to try to apply it to my project.  :slightly_smiling_face:
great
